subject: Join us at Women In Tech DC! Coupon code inside
body:
You don't often get email from hello@rallybright.com. 
Learn why this is important
Learn about what makes women leaders so effective at building high-performing teams when you join us at Women In Tech DC from May 15-16.
 
 
We're proud to sponsor 
Women in Tech DC 2024
 and would love to see you there! In fact, we have a coupon code for 25% off so you can join us.
Simply select your ticket
, enter the code RALLYBRIGHT25 at the checkout, and join us at our session and our booth.
 
Women Leaders Build Better Teams: Using Data and Technology to Improve Team Performance & Intelligence
15 May 2024 | 15:55 - 16:25 | Digital X Human Stage
 
Women build better teams, according to the data. What can we learn from how they do it?
 
Join Mike Sweeney, Chief Strategy Officer at RallyBright for insights on building inclusive, resilient and high-performing teams.
 
Some key takeaways are:
Highlights from research on the positive impact women leaders have on teams
Practical approaches to using data and technology to open the door to developing team resilience
Top tips for addressing challenges in uncertain times based on our work with technology teams
Check Out Our Session
 
Don't forget to 
grab your ticket
 with our discount code RALLYBRIGHT25 and we'll see you there!
 
Cheers,
Your friends at RallyBright
www.RallyBright.com
 
 
 
RallyBright, 7801 Lonesome Pine Lane, Bethesda, MD

subject: The secret to better revenue forecasting
body:
You don't often get email from marketing@scoro.com. 
Learn why this is important
Are you still relying on multiple spreadsheets for revenue forecasting? If so, you’re not alone.
View in browser
 
 
How to Build a Reliable Revenue Forecast
Are you still relying on multiple spreadsheets for revenue forecasting?
If so, you’re not alone. 
 
Revenue forecasting is a complex task. 
It requires multiple layers of data. And input from different teams. 
You run into bottlenecks when information sits with one person. Painful manual updates.
However, revenue forecasting is key to understanding potential problem areas. 
 
Problem areas such as the ones highlighted in the revenue forecast below. April needs additional resources to support a big month, and June needs a sales push.
Foreseeing this allows you to take action and plan proactively.
 
A reliable revenue forecast combines data from your won contracts, your sales pipeline and predictions based on your previous performance:
Won contracts
 - these are your existing projects. It should be recognized in your forecast when you expect to deliver the work. Provides accurate but short-term data for your forecast.
Sales pipeline 
- this includes proposals you have sent to your prospects that you are expecting to win. This amount should be distributed across the project span. Provides less accurate mid-term data for your forecast.
Projections based on previous performance
 - are based on results from the past and market trends. Since this requires some guesswork, it’s less reliable but it does give you a long-term view.
Each of these data sources forecasts revenue over different time spans - shown below:
 
What’s next?
You’ve seen what data is needed to build a solid revenue forecast. 
Now here’s the good news. 
Scoro brings together your ongoing projects and sales pipeline into one report.
Automatically generating your revenue forecast for you.
Your own company-wide, real-time report, allowing you to plan ahead.
 
Here it is:
 
For a detailed guide on how Scoro’s revenue report works see 
here
.
In Case You Missed It
See how easy it is to generate your revenue forecast with the demonstration below:
Automating Revenue Forecasting with Scoro
Understand the importance of forecasting, its challenges and a useful framework to follow in this webinar:
Revenue Forecasting for a Profitable Year Ahead
Tim Downs, director at Aberfield Communications, shares how he motivated his team when putting processes and policies in place in this webinar:
Act Like a Small Agency, Think Like a Big One
📍 Upcomin
g
 Webinar
 
In a competitive world, how do you stand out? Nuevo's CEO, Jax Davey, crafted his 
purpose, got
 his team behind him and is winning clients. Learn how in this inspirational webinar. 
 
Join us live on 
Wednesday, 27 March
, 2:00 PM GMT. Register 
here
. 
 
P.S. Was this content helpful?
We’d love to hear your thoughts.
Very helpful
 
It's OK
 
Not helpful
 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.
You are receiving this email because you have a Scoro account. For more information about how we process data, please see our 
Privacy Policy

subject: RE: Edrington - DE&I Micro Learnings
body:
You don't often get email from louise.macdonald@edrington.com. 
Learn why this is important
Hi Dan, 
 
Would you be able to confirm this for me please? Copying in 
@Melissa Neu
 and 
@Melonya Johnson
 in case you are out of the office. 
 
Best wishes, Louise
 
From:
 MacDonald, Louise 
Sent:
 Monday, February 5, 2024 11:51 AM
To:
 Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Edrington - DE&I Micro Learnings 
 
Hi Dan, 
 
Conscious it has been a little while since we connected. We are still hoping to move forward with Micro-Learnings. Can I just check, for perpetual site licenses on the courses, in all 4 languages (English, Latin American Spanish, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese) would we still be $28,500/course? 
 
Thanks Louise
 
Managing Bias in Performance Reviews
 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=3c9eeb1e-3d2b-4494-8163-b9ff1283b75c
 
In this short (10-15 minute) course
,
 you’ll learn how to become more aware of personal biases so that we can attend to them and interrupt them while evaluating our team members’ performance and conducting performance reviews.  
Managing Bias in Talent Reviews
 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=bf8f5de8-98ae-478b-9a71-6269d1e8e9d2
 
In this short (10-15 minute) course
,
 you’ll learn ways to reduce your bias in the talent review process so that you can promote diversity, inclusion, and objectivity, and mitigate unconscious bias that may be hampering your best intentions when it comes to reviewing talent.  
Managing Bias in Hiring
 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=09ace2b6-9d23-4039-981f-06c46182d5c6
 
This short (10-15 minute)
 
course allows us to become aware of our biases so that we can attend to them and interrupt them while evaluating and selecting diverse top talent. 
Managing Bias in Interviewing
 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=fe85349c-cb6a-4bf7-85dc-d99f3e912840
 
In this short (10-15 minute) course
,
 you’ll learn ways to mitigate unconscious biases during job interviews, so that you can promote diversity, inclusion, and objectivity and mitigate biases that may be undermining your best intentions when it comes to interviewing job candidates.  
Managing Bias in Recruiting
 
https://app.cloud.scorm.com/sc/InvitationConfirmEmail?publicInvitationId=f1332bc6-0368-472e-a986-7fd93616f071
 
In this short (10-15 minute) course, you’ll learn ways to mitigate unconscious biases during the talent sourcing and recruitment process, so that you can find and recognize diverse top talent more effectively.  
 
Disclaimer
This e-mail has been scanned for all viruses by Mimecast. Edrington is a private limited company registered in Scotland (Registered Number SC 36374) with its Registered Office at 100 Queen Street, Glasgow, G1 3DN. Please enjoy our brands responsibly.

subject: Jumpstart your teams to higher performance with these exclusive RallyBright's offerings
body:
You don't often get email from hello@rallybright.com. 
Learn why this is important
This month we're sharing news on our new RallyBright Academy workshop, as well as tactical tips on strengthening team performance.
 
Hello, Melonya —
 
In this month's Resilient Teams newsletter, we're unveiling a brand new interactive workshop for our RallyBright Academy lineup, designed to help leaders jumpstart their teams to higher performance. We also have a new RallyBright blog post on the importance of leveraging employee feedback to drive success, and tactical tips on the power of shared purpose for strengthening team performance.
 
–Your friends at RallyBright
NEW RALLYBRIGHT ACADEMY WORKSHOP - TEAM "SPARK" SESSION
 
Spark Team Performance For Your Most Critical Teams
Our 
RallyBright Academy
 offerings provide leaders and teams with customized learning and development opportunities to drive better performance and foster inclusion. We've recently added a brand new Team "Spark" Session!
 
Use this workshop to learn about the five key drivers of team resilience and outperformance, including the attitudes and behaviors that drive success. Our seminar establishes a common framework for team outperformance and dynamics. The interactive workshops offer hands-on experience for defining team-wide objectives and accountability, and tracking progress over time.
• Build connection and psychological safety
• Create team purpose and direction
• Develop mechanisms for accountability
• Co-create team norms and rules of the road
• Identify key results & critical stakeholders
If you'd like to spark greater performance for your teams with our latest RallyBright Academy workshop, be sure to reach out to us at 
cs@rallybright.com
.
LEARNING
 
Find Out the Truth: Employee Feedback
Employee feedback is an incredibly powerful tool in today’s workplace, where innovation, collaboration and team sentiment are key drivers of success. Understanding the pulse of your organization is crucial to achieving optimal business outcomes. Instead of taking a random or unproven approach to feedback, leaders can use an employee feedback platform to drive change. 
Read more 
here
 from the RallyBright blog about how leveraging the power of feedback can transform entire organizations.
 
5 Actionable Tips on How to Create a Strong Shared Purpose For Your Teams
Strengthening your team's sense of shared purpose strengthens their performance. Empowering your teams to not only meet their goals, but exceed them, is possible with the power and magic of shared purpose. Defining your team's mission and aligning your teams with your company's purpose are the keys to getting started.
 
Check out 
these solution
s from our RallyBright LinkedIn page on how to create a strong shared purpose for your teams at work.
 
 
 
 
Let's make this relationship LI-official!
Follow us on LinkedIn and you'll get insights, news and resources about resilient leadership and inclusive teamwork. So what are you waiting for? Click below to join us on our journey. 
Follow Us on LinkedIn
 
RallyBright, 7801 Lonesome Pine Lane, Bethesda, MD

subject: Webinar: Revenue Forecasting for a Profitable Year Ahead
body:
You don't often get email from marketing@scoro.com. 
Learn why this is important
Join our webinar and uncover practical tips on reliable Revenue Forecasting.
 
 
Hey Melonya,
 
Creating a 
reliable revenue forecast 
can be tough. Uncertainties in the sales pipeline, project scopes, timelines, and market conditions make it challenging. 
 
The result? You have either given up on forecasting revenue, or it takes a lot of manual effort. 
 
You can never be sure if you have enough work and revenue lined up for the coming months. 
 
To help you navigate this complexity, we are hosting a 
webinar
 on 
revenue forecasting best practices
. 
 
Our hosts, Helen and Sander, will give you practical advice on:
Creating a robust forecasting framework
Avoiding common forecasting pitfalls
Maintaining a realistic forecast throughout the year
The live Zoom webinar is on 
January 31st at 3:00 PM GMT / 10:00 AM EST
.
 
P.S. Can’t join us live?
 Register anyway, and we’ll send you a recording after the event.
We look forward to seeing you at the webinar! 
 
Best wishes,
Team Scoro
Register now!

subject: Discover RallyBright's targeted solutions for your team's most common vulnerabilities
body:
You don't often get email from hello@rallybright.com. 
Learn why this is important
This month we're kicking off the new year with curated solutions for the most common team problems and vulnerabilities.
 
Hello, Melonya —
 
In this month's Resilient Teams newsletter, we're kicking off the new year with our recently-launched RallyBright Team Accelerator Program, designed for fast-tracking and maximizing team performance. We also have expert resources to share on why hybrid work is the clear winner of the post-pandemic workplace, as well as curated solutions to the most common team problems and vulnerabilities. 
 
–Your friends at RallyBright
RALLYBRIGHT TEAM ACCELERATOR PROGRAM
 
Fast-Track Your Teams to Success with the 
RallyBright Team Accelerator Program
Our newly-launched RallyBright Team Accelerator Program gives you the science, software, and skills to quickly build high-performing teams. We offer expert guidance focused on expanding and accelerating your impact, ensuring your best teams will become the norm, not the exception.
 
Check out our proven team accelerant 
here
 designed to fast-track and maximize team performance, all according to your group’s unique needs and challenges.
LEARNING
 
Hybrid Work is the Clear Winner in the Workplace
It looks like the full Return to Office norm isn't the only work model dying out--so is Fully Remote. Today, only 1% of executives say their employees are fully remote, way down from 34% in 2022. Hybrid work is the clear winner, as 80% of business leaders are seeing gains with this strategy. This is consistent with RallyBright's findings: a hybrid approach has most often proven successful for businesses as we leave the pandemic behind us.
 
Learn more from CNBC 
here
 on our world's new normal with hybrid work replacing full in-office and fully remote setups.
 
Consolidated FAQ for Leaders Working with Teams
Are you looking for deeper insights on how to solve common problems with your teams? Check out this 12 Days of Teaming Summary: a consolidated list of distilled insights on FAQs leaders ask about working with teams. Discover solutions for successfully setting goals for your team, communicating more effectively with your team, and handling conflict between team members.
 
Find the FAQ 
here
 from RallyBright's Chief Strategy Officer, Mike Sweeney.
 
4 Common Team Problems, and How to Prevent Them
Common team problems such as unclear priorities, lack of a common purpose, or avoiding productive conflict, can hinder team performance and diminish results. This is especially true for teams that are large or contain vastly different personality types. However, if you proactively work to prevent team problems and tackle them quickly when they arise, you’ll build stronger, more resilient, and higher-performing teams.
 
Dive into our latest RallyBright resource 
here
 on the four problems that most commonly arise on teams, and targeted solutions to proactively prevent them.
 
 
 
 
Let's make this relationship LI-official!
Follow us on LinkedIn and you'll get insights, news and resources about resilient leadership and inclusive teamwork. So what are you waiting for? Click below to join us on our journey. 
Follow Us on LinkedIn
 
RallyBright, 7801 Lonesome Pine Lane, Bethesda, MD

subject: RallyBright's proven tools can help you drive immediate impact for your team's performance.
body:
You don't often get email from hello@rallybright.com. 
Learn why this is important
This month we're finishing off the year strong with helpful resources designed to assist you in building exceptional teams.
 
Hello, Melonya —
 
In this month's Resilient Teams newsletter, we're sharing the full recording from our previous webinar on key features from the RallyBright platform - be sure to check out the discussion! We also have a new RallyBright blog post on why 2024 is poised to be the year of the team, as well as additional helpful resources for building exceptional teams at your organization.
 
That's a wrap on this year. From the team at RallyBright, we wish everyone a warm Season's Greetings. Until next year!
 
–Your friends at RallyBright
 
Build Better Teams with the RallyBright Platform - Webinar Archive
Did you miss the Feature Highlights webinar? You can now watch the recording to learn about key RallyBright platform features, RallyBright Academy and RallyBright Swift!
 
Our incredible Customer Success Team shared some amazing insights on RallyBright's most powerful features for accelerating team success. During the discussion, they shared the key features from the RallyBright platform that provide game-changing insights for countless leaders around the globe.
 
Learn more about the highlighted features in the Help Center:
Timeshift Feature
Company Summary Features
Profile Comparison Feature
RallyBright Swift: 
Start Free Trial
 
If you have any questions, please contact the Customer Success Team: 
customer.success@rallybright.com
 
If you haven't already, be sure to catch the webinar in the video below!
 
RALLYBRIGHT SWIFT
 
A Free Lightweight Tool for Improving Team Performance
RallyBright Swift
 is designed to help anyone jump in and get quick, actionable results straight from us.
 
Measure your team’s resilience with pinpoint accuracy and take the right actions. Get a personalized playbook to tackle your team’s challenges, with access to guided resources tailored for your team's unique growth opportunities. After your free 14 days, you can pick up where you left off with the full RallyBright experience!
 
Check out our page on RallyBright Swift 
here
 to learn how we can help you drive immediate impact for your team's performance.
LEARNING
 
Why Teams Matter More Than Ever
In the face of unprecedented uncertainty, teams have emerged as guiding forces for success. The upcoming year is poised to be the year of the team, emphasizing the vital role teamwork plays in achieving greater success. It's essential to recognize the power of teams, ensuring they not only survive, but also thrive through disruptions by fostering strong connections and providing clear direction for everyone on the team.
 
Read 
here
 on the RallyBright blog about why 2024 is the year of the team, and how embracing teamwork as a strategic priority can propel everyone forward.
 
4 Ways to Develop a Growth-Mindset Team
As leaders, we know that people are our biggest assets. When we build teams that are constantly moving forward with innovative thinking and agility, our employees become even more invaluable. This is the sweet spot—the place where employees are engaged and the company sees the highest success. Success starts at the basics: building a growth-mindset team.
 
Learn more 
here
 from our RallyBright infographic on how you can develop a growth-mindset team for your organization.
 
 
 
 
Let's make this relationship LI-official!
Follow us on LinkedIn and you'll get insights, news and resources about resilient leadership and inclusive teamwork. So what are you waiting for? Click below to join us on our journey. 
Follow Us on LinkedIn
 
RallyBright, 7801 Lonesome Pine Lane, Bethesda, MD

body:

Hi, Melonya 👋
 
We're working on bringing you insightful tips to keep you on top of your game. We aim to collaborate with the industry's best minds but need your help to find them!
 
By 
filling out our short survey,
 we'll get to know who you follow, which forums and communities you value, and who you think gives the best advice in your industry.
 
Your responses will help shape our direction and content, ensuring we deliver you the most relevant and impactful information.
 
Complete our survey, and we'll

Thank you for your insights - it means a lot!
Fill out the survey

. We’re built for service businesses who are tired of disjointed systems, unpredictable workloads, and shrinking margins.

Subject:
 Request for the Trainings Catalogue - High on Importance and Closure (Time-Bound to Wed Oct 25,2023)
 
Hi Melonya, 
 
Hope you are doing well. 
 
I am reaching out to you with the understanding from Vivek (Genpact Sourcing team) you are an esteemed empanelled vendor partner provisioning training of behavioural skills, professional skills and growth skills for Leader, Mid-Managers and Manager personas. The target audience is Global hence the training span is across locations open to exploring the modes of facilitation too. subject: Leverage RallyBright for the science, software and skills you need to build exceptional teams.
body:
This month we're diving into why RallyBright surpasses more traditional methods for benchmarking team performance.
 
Hello, Melonya —
 
In this month's Resilient Teams newsletter, we're sharing our latest RallyBright blog post tackling why traditional employee surveys fall short, and how our platform is better-suited for helping leaders build exceptional teams. We also have a recap of RallyBright's presentation during the recent Women in Tech 2023 event in Boston.
 
Finally, we're unveiling RallyBright's brand new Leadership Experience demo! Leaders are welcome to use our lightweight tool to quickly assess and benchmark their teams' performance. 
 
–Your friends at RallyBright
LEARNING
 
RallyBright vs. Traditional Employee Survey Software
While employee surveys are essential, traditional tools and methods often fall short of capturing accurate employee sentiment and engagement. This is where RallyBright comes in--we stand out from other typical types of employee survey software and can make a tangible difference in how your team performs. 
 
Read on 
here
 for everything you need to know about employee surveys, why they often fall short, and how RallyBright can positively impact your company.
 
Use RallyBright to Discover How Adaptable Your Teams Are at Work
When teams are adaptable, they share a strong outside-in focus with both internal and external stakeholders, and they respond rapidly to data and insights. RallyBright can help your teams become more adaptable, driving each member to respond better and faster to setbacks and challenges at work.
 
So how adaptable is your team? Find out with the RallyBright Team Adaptability Quiz, a quick and free survey 
here
.
WOMEN IN TECH - BOSTON 2023 EVENT RECAP
 
Women Leaders Build Better Teams: Using Data to Improve Team Performance in a Hybrid World
RallyBright's Chief Strategy Officer, 
Mike Sweeney
, spoke at the Women in Tech 2023 event in Boston, MA. With some helpful advice from his daughters, Mike presented RallyBright's case to the women leaders in the audience. Using our science-backed, data-driven tools is key to building better teams. Plus, the data already shows that women are often better leaders than men across the board.
 
If you missed the event, check out the slides from Mike's presentation 
here.
RALLYBRIGHT LEADERSHIP EXPERIENCE DEMO
 
A Lightweight Tool for Benchmarking Your Teams
We're excited to announce RallyBright's brand new Leadership Experience demo! Our platform gives leaders the science, software and skills to understand their team's strengths and development areas. Now leaders can gain these insights right out of the gate with our brand new demo. The Leadership Experience is a light, streamlined tool designed to help anyone jump in and get quick, actionable results for their teams. 
 
We're also looking for anyone who would like to help us test out this new Leadership Experience! Please reach out to us at 
cs@rallybright.com
 if you're interested in giving the demo a try.
 
 
 
 
Let's make this relationship LI-official!
Follow us on LinkedIn and you'll get insights, news and resources about resilient leadership and inclusive teamwork. So what are you waiting for? Click below to join us on our journey. 
Follow Us on LinkedIn
 
RallyBright, 7801 Lonesome Pine Lane, Bethesda, MD 
Manage preferences

subject: Improving Customer Communication with Shareable Quotes, Gantt, and Stripe
body:
View in browser
 
 
 
Hello, Melonya 
👋
 
Welcome to the latest edition of Scoro's Structured newsletter, where we offer valuable insights and opportunities to support your day-to-day work. What will be included in this 3-minute read?
 
💡 New in Scoro: Close deals faster with Shareable Quotes
🔍 Product webinar: Simplify customer collaboration with Sharable Quotes, Gannt and Stripe
🧘 Webinar: How to prevent burnout in your team
💡 New in Scoro – Shareable Quote View
 
A quote serves several purposes in Scoro. It acts as an external price proposal for the client and an internal budgeting tool to ensure the desired margins.
 
This month, we’re also adding a collaborative dimension to quotes – you can now conveniently share quotes with clients via a link and get their immediate feedback in the same view to shorten the closing cycle.
If you want to know more, 
read about the feature
 or join the webinar below 👇
 
🔍 
WEBINAR
: Simplify customer collaboration with Shareable Quotes, Gantt and Stripe
 
Our latest product updates help you enhance collaboration and communication with your clients. Join our 
free live webinar
 to discover how to make the most out of these features:
Share quotes with clients via a link to get their immediate feedback
Align project timeline expectations and communicate progress with shareable Gantt
Accept payments quickly and securely from absolutely anywhere with Stripe integration.
4th of October 
at 15:00 BST / 10:00 ET / 07:00 PT.
 
Can’t make it? Sign up anyway, and we’ll send you a recording after the event.
Secure your spot here!
 
 
🧘 WEBINAR:
 Improving Agency's Operations to Prevent Burnout
 
In the modern landscape, the role of the Head of Operations extends beyond managing processes; it also encompasses a crucial people-centric aspect. Sian Eddy, the Head of Operations at ModernB2B, is passionate about proactively addressing burnout and nurturing well-being within her agency. 
Join us for a 
free webinar,
 where she shares her insightful findings and guidance in this essential area, as well as how to:
identify burnout and stress sooner
use data to predict employee well-being
26th October
 at 14:00 BST / 09:00 ET / 06:00 PT
 
Can’t make it? Sign up anyway, and we’ll send you a recording after the event!
Sign me up for the webinar!
 
That's it for this month's edition of Structured! 
Stay tuned for more insights in our next edition. 
 
Scoro is the work management solution for managing 
successful projects from quote to cash
. We’re built for service businesses who are tired of disjointed systems, unpredictable workloads, and shrinking margins. 
Scoro Software, 81 Rivington Street, London, England EC2A 3AY, United Kingdom 
Unsubscribe

subject: In times of immense change or disruption, focusing on adaptability is the key to your team's success
body:
This month we're diving into why teams and leaders should embrace adaptability through change and disruption.
 
Hello, Melonya —
 
In this month's Resilient Teams newsletter, we have tips to share on embracing adaptability, driving more productive meetings at work, and more. For timely insights on staying adaptable through disruption, RallyBright founder and CEO John Estafanous has a brand new blog post through the Forbes Human Resources Council. We also have some new RallyBright platform resources to help your teams on their continuous growth journey.
 
–Your friends at RallyBright
LEARNING
 
Why Your Team Should Embrace Adaptability When Facing Disruption
Staying adaptable through challenges at work can be tough. As leaders, when we’re worried about everything that can go wrong, it’s difficult to focus anywhere else. The stakes we face in high-level roles are usually high, and the price of failure can feel like too much to bear. But that is why it’s crucial to keep a level head during times of change and disruption. After all, isn’t it better to focus on recovering and growing from challenges?
 
In times of immense change or disruption, focusing on adaptability is the key to your team's success. Learn more 
here
 from RallyBright founder and CEO John Estafanous, in his post for the Forbes Human Resources Council.
RALLYBRIGHT PLATFORM RESOURCES
 
RallyBright Team Solutions: Unproductive Meetings at Work
One of the most common vulnerabilities among teams includes unproductive, useless, or ineffective meetings. These types of meetings can leave employees feeling disengaged at work. Team members tend to perceive meetings as unproductive when there’s a lack of coordination or direction, or if they view their own work as more important than checking in with the group.
 
Unproductive meetings are usually a symptom of other common issues, such as friction between departments or a lack of shared direction.
 
Check out our RallyBright resource 
here
 for tips on driving more productive meetings for your teams.
 
An Overview of Team Communication Styles
Your Team DISC style is an overview of how your team works at work, spread across four primary dimensions: 
Dominance (D)
, 
Influencer (I)
, 
Steadiness (S)
, and 
Conscientiousness (C)
. It illustrates how all the different work styles on your team come together to form a cohesive unit and explores the types of behaviors that may be commonly accepted or criticized within the unit.
 
There are numerous ways in which understanding your team DISC styles and adapting your leadership practice based on your team style can benefit you as a leader. Understanding these styles also benefits the team members you work with, and the organization that the team works within.
 
If you're interested in learning more about Team DISC communication styles, you can find our platform resource 
here
.
 
 
 
 
 
Let's make this relationship LI-official!
Follow us on LinkedIn and you'll get insights, news and resources about resilient leadership and inclusive teamwork. So what are you waiting for? Click below to join us on our journey. 
Follow Us on LinkedIn
 
RallyBright, 7801 Lonesome Pine Lane, Bethesda, MD 
Manage preferences
